chargeHist.descr: Battery or Threat to Judge, Prosecutor, or Law Enforcement Officer

result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: Battery or Threat to Judge, Prosecutor, or Law Enforcement Officer

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Steven Patrick Roling

records.addlTxt:
10:01 AM Call to Order by Court.  Appearances stated: Defendant Steven Patrick Roling appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Jeffrey Warren Erickson appeared by video for Steven Patrick Roling.  Attorney Luke Steiner appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. 

22CF35 called along with 2022TR000142, 2022TR000143, 2022TR000148

Attorney Erickson is heard on the status of the cases. Results are still pending.
Jury status hearing scheduled for December 1, 2022 at 11:30 am.
Jury status hearing on December 1, 2022 at 11:30 am.

10:08 AM cases 22CF35, 22TR142, 22TR143 & 22TR148 called - appearances stated. 
Attorney Jeffrey Warren Erickson in court for Steven Patrick Roling.  Attorney Luke Steiner appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. 

Atty Erickson is heard - def. is in custody in another county, believes def. has huber.
Atty. Steiner requests a warrant be issued - $500.00 cash bond was posted. Still awaiting test results
Court will give def. one continuance without issuing warrant since test results are not back
Jury status hearing scheduled for September 29, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Jury status hearing on September 29, 2022 at 10:00 am.

2:33 PM Call to Order by Court.  Appearances stated: Defendant Steven Patrick Roling appeared by video, in custody, Attorney Jeffrey Warren Erickson for Steven Patrick Roling appeared by video, Attorney Luke Steiner for State of Wisconsin appeared by video. 

2022TR000142, 2022TR000143, 2022TR000148 to track along as status conference; clerk will enter not guilty pleas into the record.  

22CF35 - Court reviews preliminary questionnaire and waiver of rights form with defendant. Defendant states understanding. Defendant waives right to preliminary hearing. Court accepts waiver and finds that the defendant freely, knowingly and voluntarily waives right to preliminary hearing. Court finds probable cause and binds matter over for further proceedings. 

Atty Erickson is ready to proceed with arraignment.
Information brought over.  

Atty Erickson is heard on bond.
DA is heard on bond. 
  
Court modifies bond to $500.00 cash bond. Defendant is not to possess or consume controlled substances except those specifically prescribed to the defendant. Defendant is to submit to random urinalysis at the request of law enforcement and if results are positive or defendant refuses, defendant shall submit to blood draw. 

Information has been filed. Atty Erikson waives formal reading.  Defendant will stand mute and clerk will enter a not guilty as to each count.
Jury status hearing scheduled for May 26, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Jury status hearing on May 26, 2022 at 10:00 am.

2:01 PM Call to Order by Court.  Appearances stated: Defendant Steven Patrick Roling appeared by video, in custody, Attorney Luke Steiner appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. 

Court informs Def. of nature of charges and penalty sections of criminal complaint for each count.  Def. states understanding.   

Atty Erickson is heard.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for March 11, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
Adjourned initial appearance on March 11, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
2/28/22 Inmate Request to Judge Rider and Judge Rider's 3/2/22 response to same
Per the State Public Defender's Office, Mr. Roling does qualify for a Public Defender.

1:17 PM Call to Order by Court.  Appearances stated: Defendant Steven Patrick Roling appeared by video, in custody, Attorney Luke Steiner appeared by video for State of Wiscosnin. 

Court finds probable cause. 

DA is heard on bond, requests a $1,000.00 cash bond. Defendant is not to possess or consume controlled substances except those specifically prescribed to the defendant. Defendant is to submit to random urinalysis at the request of law enforcement and if results are positive or defendant refuses, defendant shall submit to blood draw. 

Defendant comments. 

Court orders a $1,000.00 cash bond. Defendant is not to possess or consume controlled substances except those specifically prescribed to the defendant. Defendant is to submit to random urinalysis at the request of law enforcement and if results are positive or defendant refuses, defendant shall submit to blood draw. 

Court advises right to an attorney.
Hearing scheduled for March 2, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

Defendant is not to possess or consume controlled substances except those specifically prescribed to the defendant. Defendant is to submit to random urinalysis at the request of law enforcement and if results are positive or defendant refuses, defendant shall submit to blood draw.
